description: A 92-year-old Los Angeles woman became the target of overseas scammers, who convinced her to put her life savings into gold and then hand the precious metal over. Now, her daughter is looking to hold the bank that allowed the transactions responsible. Jim Axelrod reports.
title: Elderly woman becomes target of overseas gold scam

description: One of the main points of discussion for world leaders meeting at this week's United Nations General Assembly is climate change. CBS News Philadelphia reporter Joe Holden and CBS News Colorado reporter Shaun Boyd discuss the impact and how it affects voters.
title: How climate change affects communities in New Jersey and Colorado

description: Former NFL quarterback Brett Favre revealed Tuesday he has been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. He made the announcement while testifying on Capitol Hill about a welfare scandal in which he is accused of improperly using his connections to secure money for himself and his alma mater. Favre has denied all wrongdoing and paid back more than $1 million to the state. Omar Villafranca has more.
title: Former quarterback Brett Favre reveals Parkinson's diagnosis

description: Between UFC appearances, podcast interviews and cryptocurrency ventures, former President Donald Trump's campaign has made it their mission to court young men, or as it is often referred to, "the bro vote." Peter Hamby, host of the Snapchat show "Good Luck America," joins CBS News to discuss the efforts.
title: "The Bro Vote": Analyzing Trump's efforts to court young men

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are both highlighting their economic proposals in campaign stops this week. Robert Costa has the details on both candidates' plans.
title: Trump, Harris highlight economic policies

description: A new CBS News poll found that 72% of Kamala Harris voters say personal qualities are very important in their vote, versus 39% of Donald Trump voters. Political strategists Leslie Sanchez and Chuck Rocha join CBS News to discuss the numbers and examine which voters are still persuadable.
title: Personal qualities matter more to Harris voters: CBS News poll

description: The House of Representatives will fast-track its three-month funding bill to avert a government shutdown and could hold a vote as soon as Wednesday. Lawmakers also recommended Secretary of State Antony Blinken be held in contempt of Congress over testimony on Afghanistan. CBS News' Nikole Killion has the latest on Capitol Hill.
title: House could vote on bill to avert government shutdown as soon as Wednesday

description: President Biden on Tuesday delivered his final address to the United Nations General Assembly. He pushed for Israel and Hamas to accept a cease-fire deal while also urging peace in several other conflicts actoss the globe. Weijia Jiang reports.
title: Biden pushes for cease-fire deal at U.N. General Assembly

description: Israel struck southern Lebanon multiple times again on Tuesday and Hezbollah fired rockets into northern Israel in response, with the Iran-backed group vowing to keep launching rockets until the war in Gaza ends. Officials in Lebanon say more than 500 people, including 50 children, have been killed since Monday as fears of an all-out war on Israel's northern border continue to grow. Imtiaz Tyab and Chris Livesay have more.
title: Israel strikes Lebanon as Hezbollah fires rockets

description: The Justice Department has confirmed that federal prosecutors are charging Ryan Routh with the attempted assassination of former president Donald Trump. Police arrested Routh on Sept. 15 after a Secret Service agent allegedly spotted him with a high-powered rifle at a Trump-owned golf course. Routh was already facing two federal firearms charges in connection with the incident.
title: Trump golf course suspect charged with attempted assassination

description: Speaking at the U.N. Tuesday, President Biden said President Vladimir Putin's war "failed" to destroy Ukraine and weaken NATO. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang spoke with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg about the war. He urged allies to make decisions on allowing Ukraine to use long-range missiles against Russia, despite Putin's threats against it.
title: NATO secretary general warns about Putin threats on NATO over Ukraine

description: Helene could become the second hurricane to make landfall over Florida's Big Bend region this year. Jason Allen takes a look at how the state and local residents are preparing for the storm.
title: Florida's Big Bend region braces for another hurricane

description: Tropical Storm Helene is churning in the Gulf of Mexico and is expected to hit the Florida coast in the next few days, possibly as a major Category 3 hurricane. Lonnie Quinn has the forecast.
title: Tracking Helene's path

description: Suspect Ryan Routh was charged last week with two federal firearms charges after allegedly targeting former President Donald Trump.
title: Trump golf course suspect charged with attempted assassination

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Tuesday, Sept. 24, 2024

description: Former President Donald Trump outlined his plan to lower taxes for American manufacturing in Georgia on the campaign trail Tuesday, while Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign held a "Republicans for Harris-Walz" event. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa and CBS News digital reporter Aaron Navarro have the latest.
title: Trump promises lower taxes for U.S. manufacturers in Georgia

description: A woman has accused Sean "Diddy" Combs of raping her and recording the alleged attack in a newly filed lawsuit. He remains in federal custody in connection with charges of sex trafficking, racketeering conspiracy and transportation to engage in prostitution.
title: Sean "Diddy" Combs accused of rape, recording alleged attack in new lawsuit

description: Marcellus Williams was convicted in the 1998 stabbing death of Felicia Gayle in Missouri, but DNA testing raised questions.
title: Supreme Court allows execution of Marcellus Williams, denying bid for delay

description: CBS News found the song has been used in more than 4,500 TikTok videos alone, with some users believing it's a song released by Bieber.
title: Bieber song about "'Diddy' party" is likely AI-generated, researchers say

description: The Federal Reserve's interest rate cut announcement has already affected the prices of some mortgage rates and credit card interest rates. CBS MoneyWatch associate managing editor Aimee Picchi reports.
title: Federal Reserve interest rate cut already affecting some prices

description: New York City Schools Chancellor David Banks is retiring. Officials insisted Banks' decision was made before federal agents raided his home and seized his phones.
title: NYC Schools Chancellor David Banks announces retirement

description: Invitation Homes advertised rental rates without disclosing monthly "junk fees" of up to $1,700 a year, FTC alleges.
title: Invitation Homes deceived renters and will refund $48 million, FTC says

description: A report shows at least 210 people in the U.S. were charged with crimes related to their pregnancies after the Supreme Court's Dobbs ruling that overturned Roe v. Wade, according to a report by Pregnancy Justice.
title: At least 210 pregnant people faced criminal charges following Dobbs ruling, report says

description: A quarter of voters who find Donald Trump insulting are voting for him over Kamala Harris anyway.
title: Trump v. Harris poll: How much does their likability — or unlikability — matter?

description: World leaders in town for the United Nations General Assembly are also having conversations about climate change for Climate Week NYC. CBS News Philadelphia's Joe Holden spoke to New Jersey residents affected by rapid shifts on Earth.
title: World leaders meet on climate change

description: A new arrangement will soon allow American citizens to visit Qatar for longer periods of time and give Qataris access to visa-free travel to the U.S. for tourism or business.
title: U.S. and Qatar ease travel requirements, allowing Americans to stay for longer

description: The Department of Justice is suing credit card giant Visa for using its market dominance to stifle competition. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Visa tactics led to more costs for consumers.
title: U.S. sues Visa for monopolizing market

description: Tropical Storm Helene is expected to strengthen into a strong hurricane before slamming parts of Florida that border the Gulf of Mexico. CBS News Bay Area meteorologist Jessica Burch has the latest.
title: Potential Hurricane Helene could slam Florida with force

description: Ellison, a former top executive for Sam Bankman-Friend's crypto hedge fund, was sentenced Tuesday for fraud.
title: Caroline Ellison, former FTX executive, sentenced to 24 months in prison

description: Former President Donald Trump revealed more details about his economic agenda during a campaign rally in Georgia. This comes as both Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris vie for support in battleground states. CBS News campaign reporter Taurean Small has more.
title: Trump outlines economic plans, promises tariffs

description: Biden delivers final speech to U.N. General Assembly as president; Florida bracing for potential Hurricane Helene.
title: 9/24: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: President Biden will go to Africa next month for the first time as president, following through on a promise he made to visit the continent while in office.
title: Biden to visit Africa next month for first time as president, keeping a promise

description: The Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pension committee, led by Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders, is hearing testimony from Novo Nordisk CEO Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen on the exhortative prices for their drugs in the U.S. CBS News' Nancy Chen has more.
title: Ozempic, Wegovy maker grilled by Bernie Sanders-led committee over high prices

description: The Senate Judiciary Committee is hearing expert testimony to dive deeper into the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential immunity. CBS News' Nikole Killion reports from Capitol Hill.
title: Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on Supreme Court presidential immunity ruling

description: Some gold investments may be more advantageous than others in today's unusual gold market climate.
title: Gold's price is still climbing: 3 gold options to consider now

description: Scientists are concerned after seeing a large group of North Atlantic right whales​ off New York's Long Island.
title: Unusual sighting of endangered whales has scientists concerned

description: Visa exploits its market dominance to stifle competition, costing consumers and merchants billions in extra fees, feds allege.
title: Visa monopoly over debit cards hurts consumers and businesses, feds say

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is facing an expanded federal probe into dealings with foreign governments, sources tell CBS News New York. Derick Waller has the latest.
title: Eric Adams faces expanding federal investigation on foreign governments dealings

description: Former President Donald Trump outlined his economic plans while campaigning in Georgia. This comes as Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign contemplates a trip to the U.S.-Mexico border. CBS News' Olivia Rinaldi and Fin Gomez have more.
title: Trump on economic agenda, Harris may visit U.S.-Mexico border

description: The "Sarco" capsule is designed to allow a person sitting inside to push a button that injects nitrogen gas into the sealed chamber.
title: U.S. woman dies in controversial "suicide capsule" in Switzerland

description: With credit card interest rates near record highs, borrowers should carefully avoid making these mistakes in October.

description: A HELOC is arguably the most cost-effective way to borrow from your home equity this October. Here's why.

description: Joe Biden's final address as president at the United Nations General Assembly touched on current world conflicts and his hopes for the future. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more on the remarks.
title: Biden's final U.N. address as president acknowledges world despair

description: Republicans did not have enough support to change how the state allocates Electoral College votes, a move that would have benefitted former President Donald Trump.
title: Nebraska governor won't call special session to change Electoral College system

description: Mortgage interest rates have recently been falling. They could drop again on these three upcoming dates.
title: When will mortgage interest rates fall again? Watch these 3 dates

description: Lebanese residents are evacuating in southern Lebanon as fears grow of a ground operation by Israel against the Hezbollah militant group. This comes as Israeli officials say a targeted Hezbollah leader has been killed. Daniel De Simone with BBC News, a CBS News partner, reports.

description: The House Committee on Foreign Affairs is holding a hearing on Capitol Hill probing the U.S. withdrawal in Afghanistan. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has the latest.

description: Maps show possible storm surge, rainfall levels and more as Tropical Storm Helene makes its way north.

description: Kristen Bell returns to romantic comedies in Netflix's "Nobody Wants This," playing a podcast host navigating modern dating challenges.

description: Olive Garden's same-restaurant sales dropped in its most recent quarter. Now, it's tweaking its menu.

description: If you're dealing with high-rate card debt, debt consolidation could make sense to consider right now.

description: Cease-fire talks between Israel and Hamas are still reportedly transpiring as conflict in the Middle East expands into Lebanon, where Israeli strikes are apparently targeting Hezbollah leaders and weapons. David Daoud, a senior fellow at the Foundation for Defense of Democracies, joins CBS News with more.
title: Breaking down the Middle East conflict as Israel fights Hezbollah in Lebanon

description: Hall of Fame NFL quarterback Brett Favre said during testimony before Congress Tuesday he's been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.
title: Brett Favre reveals he's been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease

description: Ryan Wesley Routh will likely face more charges in the federal case against him for apparently targeting former President Donald Trump in Florida. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane is following the court proceedings.
title: More charges possible for Trump apparent assassination attempt suspect

description: Fracking has become a big talking point in the presidential election. But while it has helped boost U.S. energy production, studies have shown it's also linked to a number of environmental and human health issues, including childhood leukemia. Here's what to know.
title: The Climate Election: Fracking, explained

description: Upgrade your toolshed for less with these early Amazon Prime Big Deal Days deals.

description: President Biden addressed the United Nations General Assembly and called for unity and hope as the world grapples with conflicts, including Israel's growing operations in Gaza and Lebanon, and Ukraine's fight against Russia. CBS News' Weijia Jiang and Charlie D'Agata are joined by Zeke Miller from the Associated Press to break down the remarks.
title: Biden tells U.N. "things can get better" as Israel fights Hezbollah, Ukraine battles Russia

description: We found a ton of affordable Halloween decorations at Amazon this year. Shop our favorites today.

description: Former President Donald Trump is touring battleground states and his latest remarks argued that abortion is no longer an issue women have to worry about after the Supreme Court voted to overturn Roe v. Wade in 2022. CBS News' Caitlin Huey-Burns has more.

description: Rep your favorite NFL icons like Barry Sanders, Eli Manning, Jerry Rice and more with NFL retro jerseys.

description: A $100,000 reward is still on the table for anyone who offers information that leads to the suspects of a shooting in Birmingham, Alabama, where four were killed and more than a dozen were injured. The suspects apparently targeted at least one person in the area. CBS News' Cristian Benavides reports.
title: No suspects yet in Birmingham, Alabama, shooting where 21 were shot, officials say

description: The Federal Reserve doesn't set mortgage rates, but its interest rate decisions may influence them.
title: How closely do mortgage interest rates tend to follow the Fed's rate decisions?

description: In Netflix's "Nobody Wants This," Kristen Bell stars as a relationship podcast host who develops feelings for an unconventional rabbi. Bell joins CBS Mornings to discuss her role, working with Adam Brody, and her love for romantic comedies.
title: Kristen Bell talks new Netflix rom-com, "Nobody Wants This" and love for romantic comedies

description: In an appearance on Capitol Hill, senior executive is set to deliver an apology for IT meltdown behind mid-July havoc.
title: CrowdStrike executive to apologize for global technology crash

description: Marcellus William is facing execution in Missouri Tuesday after the state's Supreme Court and the state's governor both rejected pleas to halt the procedure. Williams has asserted his innocence, and his team is arguing the case was affected by procedural errors and prosecutorial mishandling. CBS News contributor Rebecca Roiphe breaks down the details.
title: Marcellus Williams execution set to happen in Missouri

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Former President Donald Trump praised the members of the Supreme Court that he appointed for overturning Roe v. Wade. CBS News campaign reporter Libby Cathey has more on Trump's messaging for women in key battleground states.
title: Trump praises his Supreme Court appointees for overturning Roe v. Wade

description: In the latest stop of "Three Meals," CBS News travels through Wisconsin to hear from voters ahead of the election. New polls show a tight race between Vice President Harris and former President Trump, with the state's crucial 10 electoral votes up for grabs.
title: Three Meals Wisconsin: Voters reveal what issues are on their minds

description: Republicans on the House Foreign Affairs Committee recently released a critical report about the Biden administration's handling of the chaotic exit from Afghanistan.
title: House panel weighs holding Blinken in contempt over Afghanistan testimony

description: Officials in Lebanon say more than 500 people have been killed, and thousands are injured, after the deadliest day of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah since 2006. CBS News' Chris Livesay reports, and CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more on the Biden administration's reactions to escalating tensions in the Middle East.
title: Israel, Hezbollah trade strikes, U.S. sending more troops to Middle East

description: The Russian aircraft were detected just days after about 130 U.S. soldiers were deployed to a remote Alaska island.
title: Russia planes spotted near Alaska after U.S. soldiers sent to region

description: Mortgage rates are in the 6.00% range now, but could that change? Here's what could happen in October, experts say.
title: Will mortgage rates drop in October without a Fed meeting?

description: Israel has launched missile strikes in Lebanon, killing over 500 people, as part of its ongoing conflict with Hezbollah. In response to the escalating violence, the U.S. is sending additional troops to the region. To help us understand the situation, Samantha Vinograd, a CBS News national security contributor, joins "CBS Mornings."
title: Breaking down the Middle East conflict: Israel's strikes on Hezbollah, U.S. troop movements

description: Senior investigative consumer correspondent Anna Werner looked into the high prices of weight loss drugs in the U.S. as research shows Americans pay far more for some of the popular drugs compared to people in other countries. One of the drugs, Wegovy, costs $1,300 per month in the U.S. and just over $90 in the U.K.
title: CEO of company of popular weight loss drugs to face Senate questions over high costs in U.S.

description: ExxonMobil is one of the world's biggest plastic makers. In a lawsuit, the California attorney general alleges the company lied to the public for decades to convince everyone that recycling works so they would keep buying more plastic.
title: Lawsuit accuses Exxon of lying about plastics recycling

description: President Biden to address the U.N. as Israel strikes Hezbollah, killing hundreds in Lebanon, increasing fears of an all-out war. Also, Vice President  Harris weighs a trip to the border, while Trump repeats false claims about Haitian immigrants. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: President Biden to address the U.N. as conflict between Israel, Lebanon escalates

description: The Tribe of Nova music festival was supposed to be a celebration of life, love and music for thousands of young people, but the gathering became one of the first targets of Hamas' deadliest terror attack in Israel's history. In "We Will Dance Again," more than a dozen young festival-goers tell gripping stories of how each of them managed to survive from one minute to the next.
title: We Will Dance Again | Paramount+ Official Trailer

description: Hezbollah continues firing rockets and drones at Israel as Lebanese officials say almost 560 people have been killed by Israeli airstrikes.
title: Lebanon says more than 550 killed in Israel's assault on Hezbollah

description: Novo Nordisk CEO Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen is testifying before the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pension committee on Tuesday.
title: Ozempic maker to testify before Senate committee on weight loss drug prices

description: The "Australasian narrow-nosed spookfish" has a bulging black eyes and a wispy tail.
title: New species of "ghost shark" discovered living deep in the Pacific Ocean

description: Missouri plans to execute death row prisoner Marcellus Williams on Tuesday. He was convicted of murdering a newspaper reporter in 1998, which he has always denied. But state's governor has said he will not stop the execution, despite there being significant questions about Williams' guilt.
title: Questions surround death row inmate amid scheduled execution

description: Former President Trump sought to make the case that women are worse off now. Here's what income and wealth data shows.
title: Trump claims women are poorer than 4 years ago. Is that accurate?

description: Authorties are offering $100,000 in an effort to find and capture suspects after a mass shooting on Saturday in Birmingham, Alabama. Four people were killed and 17 others injured.
title: Mother of Alabama mass shooting victim remembers her daughter as search for suspects continues

description: Ryan Routh, the man suspected in the apparent attempted assassination  of former President Donald Trump at a Florida golf course, left a handwritten confession admitting to the attempt, officials say. He is expected to be charged with attempting to assassinate the former president.
title: Suspect left note admitting to apparent Trump assassination attempt, FBI says

description: As President Biden speaks to the United Nations General Assembly as what is anticipated to be his final time as commander in chief, he is expected to touch on multiple global conflicts, including Gaza, Lebanon and Ukraine.
title: Biden expected to address global conflicts in UN speech

description: With the presidential election in just six weeks, both Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are on a battleground state blitz, with Harris returning to Pennsylvania Wednesday and Nevada this weekend. Trump will stop in Georgia, North Carolina and Michigan.
title: Harris and Trump campaign through battleground states with six weeks until election

description: Officials in Lebanon say nearly 560 people died Monday during a barrage of missile strikes that Israel says were aimed at Hezbollah rocket launchers. Mass evacuations are now underway in the southern part of the country amid fears of a possible ground invasion.
title: Nearly 560 killed in Israeli missile strikes aimed at Hezbollah

description: Some of the diamonds may have come from a necklace linked to a scandal that eventually led to Marie Antoinette's death, Sotheby's said.
title: Mysterious necklace linked to queen's demise set for auction

title: Biden to deliver final speech to U.N. General Assembly as president

description: Although China has lapped the U.S. in shifting to electric vehicles, experts say the race is just getting started. Here's what America must  do to get up speed
title: China rules the EV market. What does the US need to do to catch up?
